image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The opposition has finally put in place the last piece of its controversial nuclear policy, with modelling claiming its alternative would come in substantially cheaper than Labor's transition path to net zero.

title.children: Dutton's nuclear plan '$236b cheaper' than Labor's transition, would rely on coal past 2050

image.altText: Photo of nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: Internal debate over the nuclear modelling, and when Mr Dutton should release details, has been a source of tension within the Coalition for months.

title.children: Internal Coalition unease over nuclear costings 'distraction' as Dutton unveils modelling

image.altText: Man standing outside an outdoor pod.

props.synopsis: Outdoor pods have grown in popularity but one business has been targeting dissatisfied customers who leave negative reviews online â€” and the man behind the business has a history with several state regulators.

title.children: 'You're going to out me as a paedophile?' Customer threatened after leaving negative online review

image.altText: A black farmed mobile phone featuring a Meta logo in front of blurred social media platform logos

props.synopsis: The government wants to impose a new tax to push the tech platforms to make funding agreements with news organisations.

title.children: Facebook, Google to fund Australian journalism under new tax plan

image.altText: An older white man in a suit points as he speaks sternly in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has commuted the sentences of roughly 1,500 Americans who were released from prison and placed in home confinement during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as pardoning 39 Americans convicted of nonviolent crimes.

title.children: Biden pardons 39, commutes 1,500 sentences in record act of clemency

image.altText: A PNG rugby league football player stands among a crowd of fans holding up their hands.

props.synopsis: The "soft power" aspect to this sports diplomacy initiative has never been a secret. But in the game of regional politics, Australia went in for the hard tackle.

title.children: In a game of soft diplomacy with PNG, Australia had one thing China didn't

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese in a suit.

props.synopsis: Unveiling eagerly-awaited plans to slug tech companies to help prop up Australian journalism, Assistant Treasurer Stephen Jones insisted Labor's strategy was akin to "playing four-dimensional chess".

title.children: Can Labor win a game of '4D chess' against the tech giants?

image.altText: Penny wong.

props.synopsis: Australia has joined the overwhelming majority of countries and voted in support of an "immediate, unconditional and permanent ceasefire" in Gaza at the United Nations' General Assembly.

title.children: Australia backs 'immediate, unconditional and permanent' Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: Military vehicles driving up a dirt road along an area separated by barbed wire

props.synopsis: Shortly after Syrian president Bashar al-Assad's overthrow by rebel forces, Israel ordered its troops to enter a demilitarised buffer zone situated along the east of Syria's Golan Heights plateau it controls.

title.children: Why the Golan Heights is a flashpoint for Israel and Syria

image.altText: Artist Anthony Lister outside NSW District Court

props.synopsis: A jury was unable to decide on charges relating to two other women who alleged they were sexually assaulted by the 44-year-old artist.

title.children: Artist Anthony Lister can be identified as man at centre of long-running sexual assault trial

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street carrying shopping bags on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: All states and territories experienced population growth during the past 12 months, some much faster than others.

title.children: Australia's population grows by 552,000 despite births at 17-year low

image.altText: A search box for aÂ careers website.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate falls to 3.9pc in November, down from 4.1pc in October.

title.children: Unemployment hits 3.9pc, threatening near-term interest rate cuts

image.altText: Large billboard of man with politcal slogans

props.synopsis: Hardline youth justice law changes to sentence young offenders as adults for more than a dozen serious crimes pass Queensland parliament.

title.children: Tough youth justice laws pass Queensland parliament

image.altText: Woman speaks at press conference in front of police officer

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister and police commissioner have flagged federal support may be called upon for Alice Springs, in response to what they describe as "serious, heinous, and escalating violence" in the town.

title.children: Chief flags possible federal support to address Alice Springs crime

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking into court.

props.synopsis: An indictment alleging Bruce Lehrmann raped a woman in Queensland in October 2021 has been presented to the Toowoomba District Court.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann alleged rape indictments presented to court

image.altText: Candace Owens holds two fingers up while speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Australian Immigration Minister Tony Burke barred Ms Owens from entry in October, noting she has denied that Nazis conducted medical experimentation on Jewish people in concentration camps during World War II.

title.children: NZ reverses visa refusal for Candace Owens after Australia ban

image.altText: A dark-haired, bespectacled man in a radio studio in the 1970s.

props.synopsis: Clive Robertson was famous for breaking the rules of his profession and his often-humorous exchanges with fellow broadcaster Margaret Throsby.

title.children: ABC's 'one-off' broadcaster Clive Robertson dies aged 78

image.altText: A close up of Abu Mohammed al-Golani speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Syrian rebel leader Abu Mohammed al-Golani said he would hunt down anyone involved in the torture or killing of detainees during the ousted Syrian president's rule, dissolve the security forces of the former regime and close its prisons.Â

title.children: Syria's Golani vows to punish those responsible for torture under Assad

image.altText: Two women and a man sitting at a long table in a function room.

props.synopsis: Wine grape growers have spoken at a senate inquiry to plead for a mandatory code of conduct to ensure they get fair prices for their produce.

title.children: Grape growers at breaking point plead for mandatory code of conduct

image.altText: man wearing suit with press pack behind them

props.synopsis: As Syrians expressed obvious relief at the end of 54 years of one of the most brutal dictatorships of modern times, their neighbour Israel reacted in a very different way: it launched a bombing campaign of 480 strikes in 48 hours.

title.children: Why did Israel turn an unlikely bedfellow in Syria into a new enemy?

image.altText: Luigi Mangione wears an orange prison suit and is followed by a law enforcement officer.

props.synopsis: Accused murderer Luigi Mangione was carrying a notebook that outlined plans to kill a CEO when he was arrested at a McDonald's restaurant earlier this week, US media reports.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's notebook outlined plan to 'wack' a CEO: reports

props.synopsis: A man and woman were stuck on the roof of their submerged four-wheel drive for hours in remote WA after being swept away while trying to cross a river.

title.children: Stranded teachers rescued from car roof in rising outback floodwaters

image.altText: Karratha Generics, The The Karratha Gas Plant (KGP) is one of the most advanced, integrated gas production systems in the world, producing LNG, domestic gas, condensate and LPG. The facility is located 1260 kilometres north of Perth, Western Australia in the town of Karratha and covers about 200 hectares. July 28 2022. (ABC Image_Brendan Esposito) ARCHIVING  - KARRATHA GAS

props.synopsis: WA's Environment Minister Reece Whiby approves a 50-year extension of a major liquefied natural gas (LNG) project following a six-year approvals process.

title.children: WA minister approves 50-year extension of Woodside's North West Shelf gas project

image.altText: Onetime senior banking watchdog manager Lyndon Kingston sits in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Lyndon Allen Kingston headed credit union BCU between 2015 and 2017 when ASIC says he "betrayed his position" by committing financial crimes.Â

title.children: Ex-credit union head jailed for profiting from secret deals

image.altText: Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto, pictured outside the Federal Court in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Moira Deeming brought the lawsuit against John Pesutto, alleging the Liberal Party leader had defamed her as a Nazi sympathiser in the wake of an anti-trans rights rally.

title.children: Victorian Liberal leader vows to stay on after defamation suit loss

image.altText: A collage made up of photos of Ani and her sister, her sister Kinisimere, generic invoices and ants.

props.synopsis: From broken agreements to "filthy" practices, families and insiders share "horror stories" from inside Australia's problematic funeral industry.

title.children: 'Disgusting': Ex-employees allege 'filthy' practices at funeral home

image.altText: a 10-year-old girl wearing earrings and makeup

props.synopsis: Ten-year old Sara Sharif loved singing and dreamed of being on The X Factor. Her death at the hands of her parents sent shock waves around the globe. Warning: This story contains graphic content that may be upsetting.

title.children: Parents found guilty of shocking murder of girl who dreamed of stardom

image.altText: Yung Filly walking out of court, surrounded by media.

props.synopsis: YouTube personality Yung Filly is charged with reckless driving while out on bail in Perth where he's accused of sexually assaulting a woman while on an Australian tour.

title.children: YouTuber Yung Filly charged with driving at 158kph in Perth while on bail

image.altText: A young child with short dark hair and a dark top stands in front of a TV.

props.synopsis: From an awkward KFC commercial to a mobile billboard for a brothel, ad complaints from 2024 give insight into the direction the industry is taking.Â

title.children: KFC, Budget Direct and a brothel top 2024 ad-complaints list

image.altText: Japanese macaques in an enclosure.

props.synopsis: Launceston City Council has voted to sterilise the popular troop of macaque monkeys living in City Park as they are becoming inbred.

title.children: Tasmanian council decides to let beloved City Park monkeys die out

image.altText: Close up of Central Land Council chair looking into camera, standing in sun and wearing a CLC cap and sunnies

props.synopsis: Aboriginal land councils and the Northern Territory's anti-discrimination commissioner are the latest to join calls for an independent review into racism in the NT Police Force.

title.children: Calls strengthen in NT for independent police racism review

image.altText: A mountain beneath a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Emergency crews have found the body of a 20-year-old who went missing in the Glass House Mountains on Sunday.

title.children: Body of young hiker found on face of Queensland mountain

image.altText: The exterior of the County Court of Victoria in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The man is accused of sexually assaulting a woman after allegedly drinking alcohol and taking cocaine with her at his home.

title.children: High-profile Melbourne man accused of rape wins court bid to conceal his identity

image.altText: Three young women hold owls with graduation caps on them and gift bags.

props.synopsis: There were only three year 12 students at Balmoral K-12 College this year, but they say having a small cohort had benefits like plenty of individualised attention.

title.children: Victoria's smallest year 12 class celebrates successful year
